meanings.definition: Written works, especially those considered to have artistic or intellectual value.
meanings.sent1: In school, we study different literatures to learn about famous stories and poems.
meanings.sent2: The library has a vast collection of literatures from various authors and time periods.
meanings.sent3: The detective novel was so engaging that it made me forget about reality and dive into its world of literatures.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a treasure trove of imaginative literatures waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The power of literatures lies in their ability to transport readers to distant lands and times.

meanings.definition: The body of written works of a particular language, period, or culture.
meanings.sent1: Exploring ancient Greek literatures gives us insights into their beliefs and traditions.
meanings.sent2: The English literatures of the Renaissance period are known for their rich language and themes.
meanings.sent3: The library's collection of literatures from around the world felt like a literary treasure hunt.
meanings.sent4: His bookshelf was a reflection of his diverse interests, showcasing literatures from different cultures.
meanings.sent5: The literatures of the past serve as windows to understanding the societies that produced them.
